00048 void defgroup_copy_list(ListBase *outbase, ListBase *inbase)
00049 {
00050     bDeformGroup *defgroup, *defgroupn;
00051 
00052     outbase->first = outbase->last = NULL;
00053 
00054     for (defgroup = inbase->first; defgroup; defgroup = defgroup->next) {
00055         defgroupn = defgroup_duplicate(defgroup);
00056         BLI_addtail(outbase, defgroupn);
00057     }
00058 }
00059 
00060 bDeformGroup *defgroup_duplicate(bDeformGroup *ingroup)
00061 {
00062     bDeformGroup *outgroup;
00063 
00064     if (!ingroup)
00065         return NULL;
00066 
00067     outgroup = MEM_callocN(sizeof(bDeformGroup), "copy deformGroup");
00068 
00069     /* For now, just copy everything over. */
00070     memcpy(outgroup, ingroup, sizeof(bDeformGroup));
00071 
00072     outgroup->next = outgroup->prev = NULL;
00073 
00074     return outgroup;
00075 }

00077 /* copy & overwrite weights */
00078 void defvert_copy(MDeformVert *dvert_dst, const MDeformVert *dvert_src)
00079 {
00080     if (dvert_dst->totweight == dvert_src->totweight) {
00081         if (dvert_src->totweight)
00082             memcpy(dvert_dst->dw, dvert_src->dw, dvert_src->totweight * sizeof(MDeformWeight));
00083     }
00084     else {
00085         if (dvert_dst->dw)
00086             MEM_freeN(dvert_dst->dw);
00087 
00088         if (dvert_src->totweight)
00089             dvert_dst->dw = MEM_dupallocN(dvert_src->dw);
00090         else
00091             dvert_dst->dw = NULL;
00092 
00093         dvert_dst->totweight = dvert_src->totweight;
00094     }
00095 }
00096 
00097 /* copy an index from one dvert to another
00098  * - do nothing if neither are set.
00099  * - add destination weight if needed.
00100  */
00101 void defvert_copy_index(MDeformVert *dvert_dst, const MDeformVert *dvert_src, const int defgroup)
00102 {
00103     MDeformWeight *dw_src, *dw_dst;
00104 
00105     dw_src = defvert_find_index(dvert_src, defgroup);
00106 
00107     if (dw_src) {
00108         /* source is valid, verify destination */
00109         dw_dst = defvert_verify_index(dvert_dst, defgroup);
00110         dw_dst->weight = dw_src->weight;
00111     }
00112     else {
00113         /* source was NULL, assign zero, could also remove */
00114         dw_dst = defvert_find_index(dvert_dst, defgroup);
00115 
00116         if (dw_dst) {
00117             dw_dst->weight = 0.0f;
00118         }
00119     }
00120 }
00121 
00122 /* only sync over matching weights, don't add or remove groups
00123  * warning, loop within loop.
00124  */
00125 void defvert_sync(MDeformVert *dvert_dst, const MDeformVert *dvert_src, int use_verify)
00126 {
00127     if (dvert_src->totweight && dvert_dst->totweight) {
00128         int i;
00129         MDeformWeight *dw_src;
00130         for (i = 0, dw_src = dvert_src->dw; i < dvert_src->totweight; i++, dw_src++) {
00131             MDeformWeight *dw_dst;
00132             if (use_verify) dw_dst = defvert_verify_index(dvert_dst, dw_src->def_nr);
00133             else            dw_dst = defvert_find_index(dvert_dst, dw_src->def_nr);
00134 
00135             if (dw_dst) {
00136                 dw_dst->weight = dw_src->weight;
00137             }
00138         }
00139     }
00140 }

00142 /* be sure all flip_map values are valid */
00143 void defvert_sync_mapped(MDeformVert *dvert_dst, const MDeformVert *dvert_src,
00144                          const int *flip_map, const int flip_map_len, const int use_verify)
00145 {
00146     if (dvert_src->totweight && dvert_dst->totweight) {
00147         int i;
00148         MDeformWeight *dw_src;
00149         for (i = 0, dw_src = dvert_src->dw; i < dvert_src->totweight; i++, dw_src++) {
00150             if (dw_src->def_nr < flip_map_len) {
00151                 MDeformWeight *dw_dst;
00152                 if (use_verify) dw_dst = defvert_verify_index(dvert_dst, flip_map[dw_src->def_nr]);
00153                 else            dw_dst = defvert_find_index(dvert_dst, flip_map[dw_src->def_nr]);
00154 
00155                 if (dw_dst) {
00156                     dw_dst->weight = dw_src->weight;
00157                 }
00158             }
00159         }
00160     }
00161 }
00162 
00163 /* be sure all flip_map values are valid */
00164 void defvert_remap(MDeformVert *dvert, int *map, const int map_len)
00165 {
00166     MDeformWeight *dw = dvert->dw;
00167     unsigned int i;
00168     for (i = dvert->totweight; i != 0; i--, dw++) {
00169         if (dw->def_nr < map_len) {
00170             dw->def_nr = map[dw->def_nr];
00171 
00172             /* just in case */
00173             BLI_assert(dw->def_nr >= 0);
00174         }
00175     }
00176 }
00177 
00178 void defvert_normalize(MDeformVert *dvert)
00179 {
00180     if (dvert->totweight <= 0) {
00181         /* nothing */
00182     }
00183     else if (dvert->totweight == 1) {
00184         dvert->dw[0].weight = 1.0f;
00185     }
00186     else {
00187         MDeformWeight *dw;
00188         unsigned int i;
00189         float tot_weight = 0.0f;
00190 
00191         for (i = dvert->totweight, dw = dvert->dw; i != 0; i--, dw++) {
00192             tot_weight += dw->weight;
00193         }
00194 
00195         if (tot_weight > 0.0f) {
00196             float scalar = 1.0f / tot_weight;
00197             for (i = dvert->totweight, dw = dvert->dw; i != 0; i--, dw++) {
00198                 dw->weight *= scalar;
00199 
00200                 /* in case of division errors with very low weights */
00201                 CLAMP(dw->weight, 0.0f, 1.0f);
00202             }
00203         }
00204     }
00205 }
00206 
00207 void defvert_normalize_lock(MDeformVert *dvert, const int def_nr_lock)
00208 {
00209     if (dvert->totweight <= 0) {
00210         /* nothing */
00211     }
00212     else if (dvert->totweight == 1) {
00213         dvert->dw[0].weight = 1.0f;
00214     }
00215     else {
00216         MDeformWeight *dw_lock = NULL;
00217         MDeformWeight *dw;
00218         unsigned int i;
00219         float tot_weight = 0.0f;
00220         float lock_iweight = 1.0f;
00221 
00222         for (i = dvert->totweight, dw = dvert->dw; i != 0; i--, dw++) {
00223             if (dw->def_nr != def_nr_lock) {
00224                 tot_weight += dw->weight;
00225             }
00226             else {
00227                 dw_lock = dw;
00228                 lock_iweight = (1.0f - dw_lock->weight);
00229                 CLAMP(lock_iweight, 0.0f, 1.0f);
00230             }
00231         }
00232 
00233         if (tot_weight > 0.0f) {
00234             /* paranoid, should be 1.0 but in case of float error clamp anyway */
00235 
00236             float scalar = (1.0f / tot_weight) * lock_iweight;
00237             for (i = dvert->totweight, dw = dvert->dw; i != 0; i--, dw++) {
00238                 if (dw != dw_lock) {
00239                     dw->weight *= scalar;
00240 
00241                     /* in case of division errors with very low weights */
00242                     CLAMP(dw->weight, 0.0f, 1.0f);
00243                 }
00244             }
00245         }
00246     }
00247 }
00248 
00249 void defvert_flip(MDeformVert *dvert, const int *flip_map, const int flip_map_len)
00250 {
00251     MDeformWeight *dw;
00252     int i;
00253 
00254     for (dw = dvert->dw, i = 0; i<dvert->totweight; dw++, i++) {
00255         if (dw->def_nr < flip_map_len) {
00256             if (flip_map[dw->def_nr] >= 0) {
00257                 dw->def_nr = flip_map[dw->def_nr];
00258             }
00259         }
00260     }
00261 }
00262 
00263 void defvert_flip_merged(MDeformVert *dvert, const int *flip_map, const int flip_map_len)
00264 {
00265     MDeformWeight *dw, *dw_cpy;
00266     float weight;
00267     int i, totweight = dvert->totweight;
00268 
00269     /* copy weights */
00270     for (dw = dvert->dw, i = 0; i < totweight; dw++, i++) {
00271         if (dw->def_nr < flip_map_len) {
00272             if (flip_map[dw->def_nr] >= 0) {
00273                 /* error checkers complain of this but we'll never get NULL return */
00274                 dw_cpy = defvert_verify_index(dvert, flip_map[dw->def_nr]);
00275                 dw = &dvert->dw[i]; /* in case array got realloced */
00276 
00277                 /* distribute weights: if only one of the vertex groups was
00278                  * assigned this will halve the weights, otherwise it gets
00279                  * evened out. this keeps it proportional to other groups */
00280                 weight = 0.5f * (dw_cpy->weight + dw->weight);
00281                 dw_cpy->weight = weight;
00282                 dw->weight = weight;
00283             }
00284         }
00285     }
00286 }

00288 bDeformGroup *defgroup_find_name(Object *ob, const char *name)
00289 {
00290     /* return a pointer to the deform group with this name
00291      * or return NULL otherwise.
00292      */
00293     bDeformGroup *curdef;
00294 
00295     for (curdef = ob->defbase.first; curdef; curdef = curdef->next) {
00296         if (!strcmp(curdef->name, name)) {
00297             return curdef;
00298         }
00299     }
00300     return NULL;
00301 }
00302 
00303 int defgroup_name_index(Object *ob, const char *name)
00304 {
00305     /* Return the location of the named deform group within the list of
00306      * deform groups. This function is a combination of BLI_findlink and
00307      * defgroup_find_name. The other two could be called instead, but that
00308      * require looping over the vertexgroups twice.
00309      */
00310     bDeformGroup *curdef;
00311     int def_nr;
00312 
00313     if (name && name[0] != '\0') {
00314         for (curdef = ob->defbase.first, def_nr = 0; curdef; curdef = curdef->next, def_nr++) {
00315             if (!strcmp(curdef->name, name))
00316                 return def_nr;
00317         }
00318     }
00319 
00320     return -1;
00321 }
00322 
00323 /* note, must be freed */
00324 int *defgroup_flip_map(Object *ob, int *flip_map_len, int use_default)
00325 {
00326     int defbase_tot = *flip_map_len = BLI_countlist(&ob->defbase);
00327 
00328     if (defbase_tot == 0) {
00329         return NULL;
00330     }
00331     else {
00332         bDeformGroup *dg;
00333         char name[sizeof(dg->name)];
00334         int i, flip_num, *map = MEM_mallocN(defbase_tot * sizeof(int), __func__);
00335 
00336         for (i = 0; i < defbase_tot; i++) {
00337             map[i] = -1;
00338         }
00339 
00340         for (dg = ob->defbase.first, i = 0; dg; dg = dg->next, i++) {
00341             if (map[i] == -1) { /* may be calculated previously */
00342 
00343                 /* in case no valid value is found, use this */
00344                 if (use_default)
00345                     map[i] = i;
00346 
00347                 flip_side_name(name, dg->name, FALSE);
00348                 if (strcmp(name, dg->name)) {
00349                     flip_num = defgroup_name_index(ob, name);
00350                     if (flip_num >= 0) {
00351                         map[i] = flip_num;
00352                         map[flip_num] = i; /* save an extra lookup */
00353                     }
00354                 }
00355             }
00356         }
00357         return map;
00358     }
00359 }
00360 
00361 /* note, must be freed */
00362 int *defgroup_flip_map_single(Object *ob, int *flip_map_len, int use_default, int defgroup)
00363 {
00364     int defbase_tot = *flip_map_len = BLI_countlist(&ob->defbase);
00365 
00366     if (defbase_tot == 0) {
00367         return NULL;
00368     }
00369     else {
00370         bDeformGroup *dg;
00371         char name[sizeof(dg->name)];
00372         int i, flip_num, *map = MEM_mallocN(defbase_tot * sizeof(int), __func__);
00373 
00374         for (i = 0; i < defbase_tot; i++) {
00375             map[i] = use_default ? i : -1;
00376         }
00377 
00378         dg = BLI_findlink(&ob->defbase, defgroup);
00379 
00380         flip_side_name(name, dg->name, FALSE);
00381         if (strcmp(name, dg->name)) {
00382             flip_num = defgroup_name_index(ob, name);
00383 
00384             if (flip_num >= 0) {
00385                 map[defgroup] = flip_num;
00386                 map[flip_num] = defgroup;
00387             }
00388         }
00389 
00390         return map;
00391     }
00392 }
00393 
00394 int defgroup_flip_index(Object *ob, int index, int use_default)
00395 {
00396     bDeformGroup *dg = BLI_findlink(&ob->defbase, index);
00397     int flip_index = -1;
00398 
00399     if (dg) {
00400         char name[sizeof(dg->name)];
00401         flip_side_name(name, dg->name, 0);
00402 
00403         if (strcmp(name, dg->name))
00404             flip_index = defgroup_name_index(ob, name);
00405     }
00406 
00407     return (flip_index == -1 && use_default) ? index : flip_index;
00408 }

00410 static int defgroup_find_name_dupe(const char *name, bDeformGroup *dg, Object *ob)
00411 {
00412     bDeformGroup *curdef;
00413 
00414     for (curdef = ob->defbase.first; curdef; curdef = curdef->next) {
00415         if (dg != curdef) {
00416             if (!strcmp(curdef->name, name)) {
00417                 return 1;
00418             }
00419         }
00420     }
00421 
00422     return 0;
00423 }
00424 
00425 static int defgroup_unique_check(void *arg, const char *name)
00426 {
00427     struct {Object *ob; void *dg;} *data = arg;
00428     return defgroup_find_name_dupe(name, data->dg, data->ob);
00429 }

00431 void defgroup_unique_name(bDeformGroup *dg, Object *ob)
00432 {
00433     struct {Object *ob; void *dg;} data;
00434     data.ob = ob;
00435     data.dg = dg;
00436 
00437     BLI_uniquename_cb(defgroup_unique_check, &data, "Group", '.', dg->name, sizeof(dg->name));
00438 }

00440 BLI_INLINE int is_char_sep(const char c)
00441 {
00442     return ELEM4(c, '.', ' ', '-', '_');
00443 }
00444 
00445 /* finds the best possible flipped name. For renaming; check for unique names afterwards */
00446 /* if strip_number: removes number extensions
00447  * note: don't use sizeof() for 'name' or 'from_name' */
00448 void flip_side_name(char name[MAX_VGROUP_NAME], const char from_name[MAX_VGROUP_NAME], int strip_number)
00449 {
00450     int     len;
00451     char    prefix[MAX_VGROUP_NAME]  = "";   /* The part before the facing */
00452     char    suffix[MAX_VGROUP_NAME]  = "";   /* The part after the facing */
00453     char    replace[MAX_VGROUP_NAME] = "";   /* The replacement string */
00454     char    number[MAX_VGROUP_NAME]  = "";   /* The number extension string */
00455     char    *index = NULL;
00456 
00457     /* always copy the name, since this can be called with an uninitialized string */
00458     BLI_strncpy(name, from_name, MAX_VGROUP_NAME);
00459 
00460     len = BLI_strnlen(from_name, MAX_VGROUP_NAME);
00461     if (len < 3) {
00462         /* we don't do names like .R or .L */
00463         return;
00464     }
00465 
00466     /* We first check the case with a .### extension, let's find the last period */
00467     if (isdigit(name[len - 1])) {
00468         index = strrchr(name, '.'); // last occurrence
00469         if (index && isdigit(index[1]) ) { // doesnt handle case bone.1abc2 correct..., whatever!
00470             if (strip_number == 0) {
00471                 BLI_strncpy(number, index, sizeof(number));
00472             }
00473             *index = 0;
00474             len = BLI_strnlen(name, MAX_VGROUP_NAME);
00475         }
00476     }
00477 
00478     BLI_strncpy(prefix, name, sizeof(prefix));
00479 
00480     /* first case; separator . - _ with extensions r R l L  */
00481     if (is_char_sep(name[len - 2]) ) {
00482         switch(name[len - 1]) {
00483             case 'l':
00484                 prefix[len - 1] = 0;
00485                 strcpy(replace, "r");
00486                 break;
00487             case 'r':
00488                 prefix[len - 1] = 0;
00489                 strcpy(replace, "l");
00490                 break;
00491             case 'L':
00492                 prefix[len - 1] = 0;
00493                 strcpy(replace, "R");
00494                 break;
00495             case 'R':
00496                 prefix[len - 1] = 0;
00497                 strcpy(replace, "L");
00498                 break;
00499         }
00500     }
00501     /* case; beginning with r R l L , with separator after it */
00502     else if (is_char_sep(name[1]) ) {
00503         switch(name[0]) {
00504             case 'l':
00505                 strcpy(replace, "r");
00506                 BLI_strncpy(suffix, name + 1, sizeof(suffix));
00507                 prefix[0] = 0;
00508                 break;
00509             case 'r':
00510                 strcpy(replace, "l");
00511                 BLI_strncpy(suffix, name + 1, sizeof(suffix));
00512                 prefix[0] = 0;
00513                 break;
00514             case 'L':
00515                 strcpy(replace, "R");
00516                 BLI_strncpy(suffix, name + 1, sizeof(suffix));
00517                 prefix[0] = 0;
00518                 break;
00519             case 'R':
00520                 strcpy(replace, "L");
00521                 BLI_strncpy(suffix, name + 1, sizeof(suffix));
00522                 prefix[0] = 0;
00523                 break;
00524         }
00525     }
00526     else if (len > 5) {
00527         /* hrms, why test for a separator? lets do the rule 'ultimate left or right' */
00528         index = BLI_strcasestr(prefix, "right");
00529         if (index == prefix || index == prefix + len - 5) {
00530             if (index[0] == 'r')
00531                 strcpy(replace, "left");
00532             else {
00533                 if (index[1] == 'I')
00534                     strcpy(replace, "LEFT");
00535                 else
00536                     strcpy(replace, "Left");
00537             }
00538             *index = 0;
00539             BLI_strncpy(suffix, index + 5, sizeof(suffix));
00540         }
00541         else {
00542             index = BLI_strcasestr(prefix, "left");
00543             if (index == prefix || index == prefix + len - 4) {
00544                 if (index[0] == 'l')
00545                     strcpy(replace, "right");
00546                 else {
00547                     if (index[1] == 'E')
00548                         strcpy(replace, "RIGHT");
00549                     else
00550                         strcpy(replace, "Right");
00551                 }
00552                 *index = 0;
00553                 BLI_strncpy(suffix, index + 4, sizeof(suffix));
00554             }
00555         }
00556     }
00557 
00558     BLI_snprintf (name, MAX_VGROUP_NAME, "%s%s%s%s", prefix, replace, suffix, number);
00559 }
00560 
00561 float defvert_find_weight(const struct MDeformVert *dvert, const int defgroup)
00562 {
00563     MDeformWeight *dw = defvert_find_index(dvert, defgroup);
00564     return dw ? dw->weight : 0.0f;
00565 }
00566 
00567 /* take care with this the rationale is:
00568  * - if the object has no vertex group. act like vertex group isn't set and return 1.0,
00569  * - if the vertex group exists but the 'defgroup' isn't found on this vertex, _still_ return 0.0
00570  *
00571  * This is a bit confusing, just saves some checks from the caller.
00572  */
00573 float defvert_array_find_weight_safe(const struct MDeformVert *dvert, const int index, const int defgroup)
00574 {
00575     if (defgroup == -1 || dvert == NULL)
00576         return 1.0f;
00577 
00578     return defvert_find_weight(dvert + index, defgroup);
00579 }
00580 
00581 
00582 MDeformWeight *defvert_find_index(const MDeformVert *dvert, const int defgroup)
00583 {
00584     if (dvert && defgroup >= 0) {
00585         MDeformWeight *dw = dvert->dw;
00586         unsigned int i;
00587 
00588         for (i = dvert->totweight; i != 0; i--, dw++) {
00589             if (dw->def_nr == defgroup) {
00590                 return dw;
00591             }
00592         }
00593     }
00594 
00595     return NULL;
00596 }
00597 
00598 /* Ensures that mv has a deform weight entry for the specified defweight group */
00599 /* Note this function is mirrored in editmesh_tools.c, for use for editvertices */
00600 MDeformWeight *defvert_verify_index(MDeformVert *dvert, const int defgroup)
00601 {
00602     MDeformWeight *dw_new;
00603 
00604     /* do this check always, this function is used to check for it */
00605     if (!dvert || defgroup < 0)
00606         return NULL;
00607 
00608     dw_new = defvert_find_index(dvert, defgroup);
00609     if (dw_new)
00610         return dw_new;
00611 
00612     dw_new = MEM_callocN(sizeof(MDeformWeight) * (dvert->totweight + 1), "deformWeight");
00613     if (dvert->dw) {
00614         memcpy(dw_new, dvert->dw, sizeof(MDeformWeight) * dvert->totweight);
00615         MEM_freeN(dvert->dw);
00616     }
00617     dvert->dw = dw_new;
00618     dw_new += dvert->totweight;
00619     dw_new->weight = 0.0f;
00620     dw_new->def_nr = defgroup;
00621     /* Group index */
00622 
00623     dvert->totweight++;
00624 
00625     return dw_new;
00626 }

00629 
00630 /* Adds the given vertex to the specified vertex group, with given weight.
00631  * warning, this does NOT check for existing, assume caller already knows its not there */
00632 void defvert_add_index_notest(MDeformVert *dvert, int defgroup, const float weight)
00633 {
00634     MDeformWeight *dw_new;
00635 
00636     /* do this check always, this function is used to check for it */
00637     if (!dvert || defgroup < 0)
00638         return;
00639 
00640     dw_new = MEM_callocN(sizeof(MDeformWeight) * (dvert->totweight + 1), "defvert_add_to group, new deformWeight");
00641     if (dvert->dw) {
00642         memcpy(dw_new, dvert->dw, sizeof(MDeformWeight) * dvert->totweight);
00643         MEM_freeN(dvert->dw);
00644     }
00645     dvert->dw = dw_new;
00646     dw_new += dvert->totweight;
00647     dw_new->weight = weight;
00648     dw_new->def_nr = defgroup;
00649     dvert->totweight++;
00650 }
00651 
00652 
00653 /* Removes the given vertex from the vertex group.
00654  * WARNING: This function frees the given MDeformWeight, do not use it afterward! */
00655 void defvert_remove_group(MDeformVert *dvert, MDeformWeight *dw)
00656 {
00657     if (dvert && dw) {
00658         MDeformWeight *dw_new;
00659         int i = dw - dvert->dw;
00660 
00661         /* Security check! */
00662         if (i < 0 || i >= dvert->totweight) {
00663             return;
00664         }
00665 
00666         dvert->totweight--;
00667         /* If there are still other deform weights attached to this vert then remove
00668          * this deform weight, and reshuffle the others.
00669          */
00670         if (dvert->totweight) {
00671             dw_new = MEM_mallocN(sizeof(MDeformWeight) * (dvert->totweight), __func__);
00672             if (dvert->dw) {
00673 #if 1           /* since we don't care about order, swap this with the last, save a memcpy */
00674                 if (i != dvert->totweight) {
00675                     dvert->dw[i] = dvert->dw[dvert->totweight];
00676                 }
00677                 memcpy(dw_new, dvert->dw, sizeof(MDeformWeight) * dvert->totweight);
00678 #else
00679                 memcpy(dw_new, dvert->dw, sizeof(MDeformWeight) * i);
00680                 memcpy(dw_new + i, dvert->dw + i + 1, sizeof(MDeformWeight) * (dvert->totweight - i));
00681 #endif
00682                 MEM_freeN(dvert->dw);
00683             }
00684             dvert->dw = dw_new;
00685         }
00686         else {
00687             /* If there are no other deform weights left then just remove this one. */
00688             MEM_freeN(dvert->dw);
00689             dvert->dw = NULL;
00690         }
00691     }
00692 }
00693 
00694 void defvert_clear(MDeformVert *dvert)
00695 {
00696     if (dvert->dw) {
00697         MEM_freeN(dvert->dw);
00698         dvert->dw = NULL;
00699     }
00700 
00701     dvert->totweight = 0;
00702 }
